department: Public Works and Government Services -> Ministère des travaux publics et des services gouvernementaux
short_summary: Plumbing contractor for Laurentian Forestry Center (LFC)
description: The Contract is scheduled to start on January 9, 2024, and to end on March 31, 2025.
full_summary:
================
**EF944-240786 Plumbing Contractor - Laurentian Forestry Center**

**Reference Number:** WS4330284788-Doc4330284868
**Publication Date:** December 1, 2023
** Tender Closing Date:** January 9, 2024, 2:00 p.m. EST

The Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) is issuing a Request for Proposal (RFP) for the acquisition of plumbing construction services at the Laurentian Forestry Center (LFC) in Quebec, Canada.

**RFP Requirements:**

The chosen contractor will provide plumbing construction services, including installation, maintenance, and repair of plumbing systems.

**Contract Duration:** The expected contract start date is January 9, 2024, and the expected contract end date is March 31, 2025.

**Tender Evaluation:**

The tender evaluation will be based on the best price. The proposals submitted after the tender closing date will be considered non-responsive.

**Trade Agreements:**

This tender is subject to trade agreements, including the Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA), the Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA), the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA), the Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement, and the World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA).

**Regions of Delivery:**

The services will be delivered in Quebec (except National Capital Region).

**Contact Information:**

For further information, please contact Moses, Anton (SPAC/PSPC) at anton.moses@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca or visit the tender URL: https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/18167720.

**Important Dates:**

*   Tender Closing Date: January 9, 2024, 2:00 p.m. EST
*   Expected Contract Start Date: January 9, 2024
*   Expected Contract End Date: March 31, 2025

The requirement documents can be accessed on the Government Electronic Tendering Service (GETS) website. Interested contractors are invited to submit their proposals by the tender closing date and time. Late submissions will not be considered.?>/a>

Note: The original entry has been condensed to only include the most relevant information while omitting extraneous data. The rewritten entry maintains a professional tone and meets the 400-word limit.
